item.title: Conducting Stakeholder Interviews and Surveys
item.description: This course will teach you how as a product manager you can use interviews and surveys to better understand stakeholder needs and motivations.

item.title: Assembling and Empowering Project Teams
item.description: The most important job of any project leader is facilitating the success of their teams. In this course, you’ll learn to form, develop, guide, and empower high-functioning teams capable of addressing the most pressing needs of today’s organizations.

item.title: Cisco Enterprise Networks: Troubleshooting BGP and GRE Tunnels
item.description: If you need to bridge the gap to get into the network security or service provider space, or if you just need to pass the ENCOR exam, this course will test and hone fundamental troubleshooting skills related to BGP, redistribution, and GRE tunnels.

item.title: Architecting ASP.NET Core Applications: Best Practices
item.description: Creating a testable and maintainable application in .NET Core requires a solid foundation. This course will teach you best practices for creating an architecture for your ASP.NET Core applications.

item.title: Microsoft Azure IoT Developer: Configure Physical IoT Devices
item.description: There are many options available to configure IoT devices to communicate with the Azure IoT Stack. ​This course will teach you​ the required skills to configure Physical IoT devices as tested in the AZ220 Azure IoT Developer certification.

item.title: Leveraging Parallel Streams for Fast Data Processing in Java
item.description: Parallelism is an amazing feature brought by the Stream API in Java 8. In this course, you will learn how parallel streams are working under the hood, how to use them to improve the performances of your applications, and when to avoid them.

item.title: Adding Metadata with Java Annotations
item.description: Incorporating custom metadata is an essential part of working in Java. This course will teach you how to add custom metadata with Java annotations.

item.title: Defense Evasion with Veil
item.description: In this course, Red Teamers will learn how to utilize the Veil to easily create unique payloads which will execute your preferred payload. T1027 on the specified target system T1480.001.

item.title: Securing and Integrating Components of your Application
item.description: In this course, application developers learn how to design and develop cloud-native applications that seamlessly integrate managed services from Google Cloud. Through a combination of presentations, demos, and hands-on labs, participants learn how to apply best practices for application development and use the appropriate Google Cloud storage services for object storage, relational data, caching, and analytics. Learners can choose to complete labs in their favorite language: Node.js, Java, or Python.

item.title: Build Your First Data Visualization with NVD3
item.description: This course will teach you how to use NVD3 to build reusable charts and chart components for d3.js without taking away the power that d3.js gives you as well as visualize different datasets on your web applications.

item.title: Getting Started With Application Development
item.description: In this course, application developers learn how to design and develop cloud-native applications that seamlessly integrate managed services from Google Cloud. Participants learn how to apply best practices for application development and use the appropriate Google Cloud storage services for object storage, relational data, caching, and analytics.

item.title: App Deployment, Debugging, and Performance
item.description: In this course, application developers learn how to design and develop cloud-native applications that seamlessly integrate managed services from Google Cloud. Through a combination of presentations, demos, and hands-on labs, participants learn how to apply best practices for application development and use the appropriate Google Cloud storage services for object storage, relational data, caching, and analytics. Learners can choose to complete labs in their favorite language: Node.js, Java, or Python.

item.title: Microsoft Azure Developer: Develop Event-based Solutions
item.description: This course will teach you the skills needed to build event-based solutions with Azure Event Grid, Azure Event Hubs, and Azure Notification Hubs. This course will also help you prepare for the Developing Solutions for Microsoft Azure AZ-204 certification exam.

item.title: Creating Deployment Packages for SharePoint Framework Projects
item.description: SharePoint Framework is the supported way to develop modern customizations for SharePoint. This course will teach you how to create deployment packages for SharePoint Framework solutions and perform associated lifecycle management tasks.

item.title: Fundamentals of Java Testing
item.description: This course will teach you to write automated tests for your code and how to implement this in Java including Junit, TDD and how to structure your code for testability.

item.title: Getting Started with MLBox
item.description: This course will teach you how to use MLBox for quickly building high quality automated machine learning models.

item.title: Build Your First Data Visualization with Altair
item.description: This course will teach you how to build a simple data visualization using the Altair API in Python.

item.title: Troubleshooting with Wireshark: Analyzing and Decrypting TLS Traffic in Wireshark (Using HTTPs)
item.description: This course will walk you through TLS encryption protocols and the handshake, and then use Wireshark to decrypt HTTPs traffic after capturing the session keys on your local machine.

item.title: Managing New Product Development
item.description: This course will teach you to create, manage, and enhance new product development processes within your organization.

item.title: Microsoft Azure IoT Developer: Set up and Deploy IoT Edge Devices
item.description: Are you preparing for the Microsoft Azure IoT Developer Specialty exam, AZ-220? This course will teach you how to set up and deploy an IoT Edge device.

item.title: Microsoft DevOps Solutions: Designing a Package Management Strategy
item.description: This course will teach you how to design and implement an effective package management solution and versioning strategy to deliver software more effectively.

item.title: Serving as a Project Leader
item.description: Organizations increasingly rely on projects to generate value, while emerging methodologies question how project work gets done. This course explores how an adaptive mindset and servant approach help project leaders succeed in any environment.

item.title: Publishing Progressive Web Apps
item.description: You have already published a Progressive Web App. This course will teach you how to distribute your PWA to all possible users without a browser manual installation, for enterprise users and end-users through the app stores.

item.title: Protocol Deep Dive: DNS
item.description: Billions of number sets are impossible to remember, that's why DNS is critical to internal networks and the Internet. This course will teach you how DNS works from configuration to security. Packets will be analyzed with Wireshark at every step.

item.title: Developing Change Readiness Skills
item.description: This course takes the guesswork out from change readiness. It gives you everything from identifying your individual reasons for change, the framework to develop change readiness, and how to apply it in a team setting.

item.title: Build your First Data Visualization with n3-charts
item.description: Understanding your data is key to building a successful business. ​This course will teach you​ how to effectively visualize your data using n3-charts by integrating line and column charts in your Angularjs applications.

item.title: Managing Data and Memory Allocation in C
item.description: Dynamic memory management is a core part of any program written in C. This course will teach you how to safely allocate memory at runtime and will give you the tools you need to facilitate the creation of C programs that are memory-efficient.

item.title: Getting Started with Remote Product Management
item.description: As companies were forced to have their employees work remotely due to the pandemic, not everyone was prepared for how different the work dynamics will be in this new set-up. This course will help you through that transition.

item.title: SharePoint Framework Development with PnP
item.description: This course will teach you how to use SharePoint Framework extensions and Microsoft Patterns and Practices to create an app for SharePoint as well as leverage connections to other Microsoft 365 services.

item.title: Testing a Rails Application
item.description: This course will teach you how to utilize the power of Ruby’s integrated testing libraries to locate and resolve errors and bugs with your Ruby-based web apps.

item.title: RxJS Patterns in Angular
item.description: Join Deborah Kurata for a walk through several common coding scenarios and useful RxJS patterns to implement those scenarios.

item.title: Introducing StackBlitz for Enterprise
item.description: Join Eric Simons in this Enterprise NG conference session that introduces Stackblitz for the enterprise.

item.title: Nx, the Fun Bits
item.description: In this quick Enterprise NG conference session, Yvonne Allen talks about the fun parts of Nx.

item.title: Test Harnesses in Angular
item.description: Join Emma Twersky in this Enterprise NG conference session that discusses test harnesses in Angular.

item.title: Deploying Secure Apps that Scale
item.description: In this Enterprise NG conference session, John Papa will teach you how to build a static web app on Azure and go from GitHub repo to global scale.

item.title: The Microfrontend Revolution: Using Webpack 5 Module Federation with Angular
item.description: In this Enterprise NG conference session, you will learn how to use Webpack 5 Module Federation to create microfrontends with Angular.

item.description: Based on his work at DAZN, Luca Mezzalira explains how to implement micro-frontends using the Micro-Frontends Decisions Framework; 4 pillars will guide the design of any micro-frontends project.

item.title: Adding Real Time Collaboration to Angular Apps with Fluid
item.description: In this Enterprise NG conference session, Dan Wahlin discusses how to add a robust set of real time collaboration features into your app with a new Open Source project called “Fluid”.

item.description: In this Enterprise NG conference talk, Jules Kremer and Misko Hevery share the current state of Angular inside Google.

item.description: Join Lara Newsom for this Enterprise NG conference session focused on state management anti-patterns.

item.title: Nx for Angular CLI Users
item.description: Join Jeff Cross and Katerina Skroumpelou for this Enterprise NG conference session as they talk about everything Nx does to help you develop any Angular application better and faster.

item.title: Using a C Preprocessor (CPP)
item.description: This course will teach you the role of C Preprocessor in the C programming language. You'll learn how C Preprocessor plays a role during the compilation process of a C program and how you can use various preprocessor directives practically.

item.title: Microsoft Azure IoT Developer: Build Device Messaging and Communication
item.description: This course will teach you​ the required skills to configure Device Messaging and Communication as tested in the AZ220 Azure IoT Developer certification.

item.title: Microsoft Azure Solutions Architect: Implement a Containerization Strategy
item.description: This course will teach you how to implement container-based applications with Azure Container Registry, Container Instances, and Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS).

item.title: Enterprise Search: Executive Briefing
item.description: This executive briefing will teach you why Enterprise Search matters, how it is used in the real world, and provides an overview of how search works so that you can apply in your enterprise..
